sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"最终的，最后的"之意。
means: final ： 指到达终点，多含果断、明确或最后终结的强烈意味。
last ： 指一系列事物的最后一个，可表示次序、顺序或时间。
ultimate ： 较正式用词，强调已到了极限。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"持续"之意。
means: persist ： 强调超过了指定的或正常的时间。
last ： 着重存在的时间相当长，超过正常的或所期望的时间。
endure与last同义，但还指经受住，有能耐忍受而并不受损。
continue ： 多指过程，强调持续而无终止，常含不间断之意。

entry.def: You use last in expressions such as last Friday ,last night, and last year to refer, for example, to the most recent Friday, night, or year.
entry.tran: （表示最近过去的）刚过去的星期五/昨晚/去年

example.ex: I got married last July...
example.tran: 我在刚过去的7月里结了婚。

example.ex: He never made it home at all last night...
example.tran: 他昨晚根本没回家。

entry.def: The last event, person, thing, or period of time is the most recent one.

example.ex: Much has changed since my last visit...
example.tran: 从我上次去到现在，很多事情已经变了。

example.ex: At the last count inflation was 10.9 per cent...
example.tran: 最近一次统计显示通胀率为10.9%。

entry.def: If something last happened on a particular occasion, that is the most recent occasion on which it happened.

example.ex: When were you there last?...
example.tran: 你上次去是什么时候？

example.ex: The house is a little more dilapidated than when I last saw it...
example.tran: 那房子比我上次见到时更破旧了些。

entry.def: The last thing, person, event, or period of time is the one that happens or comes after all the others of the same kind.

example.ex: This is his last chance as prime minister.
example.tran: 这是他作为首相的最后机会。

example.ex: ...the last three pages of the chapter...
example.tran: 该章最后3页

entry.def: If you do something last, you do it after everyone else does, or after you do everything else.

example.ex: I testified last...
example.tran: 我最后一个作证。

example.ex: I was always picked last for the football team at school...
example.tran: 在学校里分队踢足球时，我总是最后被挑的那一个。

entry.def: If you are the last to do or know something, everyone else does or knows it before you.

example.ex: She was the last to go to bed...
example.tran: 她最后一个上床。

example.ex: Riccardo and I are always the last to know what's going on.
example.tran: 我和里卡尔多总是最后才知道发生什么事情。

entry.def: Last is used to refer to the only thing, person, or part of something that remains.

example.ex: Jed nodded, finishing off the last piece of pizza.
example.tran: 杰德点点头，把最后一块比萨饼吃完。

example.ex: ...the freeing of the last hostage.
example.tran: 最后一名人质的获释

entry.def: You use last before numbers to refer to a position that someone has reached in a competition after other competitors have been knocked out.
entry.tran: （竞赛中）最后留下的，排位在前的

example.ex: Sampras reached the last four at Wimbledon.
example.tran: 桑普拉斯杀入了温布尔登四强。

example.ex: ...the only woman among the authors making it through to the last six.
example.tran: 进入最后6人名单的唯一一位女作家

entry.def: You can use last to indicate that something is extremely undesirable or unlikely.
entry.tran: 最不想要的；最不可能的

example.ex: The last thing I wanted to do was teach...
example.tran: 我最不想干的事情就是教书。

example.ex: He would be the last person who would do such a thing.
example.tran: 他最不可能干这种事情。

entry.def: The last you see of someone or the last you hear of them is the final time that you see them or talk to them.

example.ex: She disappeared shouting, 'To the river, to the river!' And that was the last we saw of her...
example.tran: 她高喊着“往河里去，往河里去！”然后就消失了。那是我们最后一次看到她的情形。

example.ex: I had a feeling it would be the last I heard of him.
example.tran: 我有一种感觉，这将是我最后一次听到他的消息。

entry.def: If an event, situation, or problem lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to exist or happen for that length of time.
entry.tran: 持续，延续，维持（一段时间）

example.ex: The marriage had lasted for less than two years...
example.tran: 这段婚姻维持了不到两年。

example.ex: The games lasted only half the normal time...
example.tran: 比赛只持续了通常时间的一半。

entry.def: If something lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to be able to be used for that time, for example because there is some of it left or because it is in good enough condition.
entry.tran: 够用，保持可用状态（一段时间）

example.ex: You only need a very small blob of glue, so one tube lasts for ages...
example.tran: 每次只需一点点胶水而已，因此一管可以用很长时间。

example.ex: The repaired sail lasted less than 24 hours...
example.tran: 修好的帆支撑了不到24小时。

entry.def: You can use last in expressions such as last the game ,last the course, and last the week, to indicate that someone manages to take part in an event or situation right to the end, especially when this is very difficult for them.

example.ex: They wouldn't  have lasted the full game...
example.tran: 他们本不可能撑完整场比赛的。

example.ex: I almost lasted the two weeks. I only had a couple of days to do.
example.tran: 我几乎撑过了这两个星期。我只有几天时间去做。

entry.def: If you say that something has happened at last or at long last you mean it has happened after you have been hoping for it for a long time.

example.ex: I'm  so glad that we've found you at last!...
example.tran: 我们终于找到你了，我真是太高兴了！

example.ex: Here, at long last, was the moment he had waited for...
example.tran: 他等待已久的时刻终于到来。

entry.def: You use expressions such as the night before last ,the election before last and the leader before last to refer to the period of time, event, or person that came immediately before the most recent one in a series.
entry.tran: 前天晚上／ 上上次选举／上上任领导人

example.ex: It was the dog he'd heard the night before last...
example.tran: 他前晚听到的是狗叫声。

example.ex: In the budget before last a tax penalty on the mobile phone was introduced.
example.tran: 上上次的预算案中对移动电话引入了惩罚性税收。

entry.def: If someone breathes their last, they die.

You can use phrases such as the last but one, the last but two, or the last but three, to refer to the thing or person that is, for example, one, two, or three before the final person or thing in a group or series.
entry.tran: 倒数第二／倒数第三／ 倒数第四

example.ex: It's the last but one day in the athletics programme...
example.tran: 那是田径比赛结束的前一天。

example.ex: The British team finished last but one.
example.tran: 英国队位列倒数第二。

entry.def: You use every last to emphasize that you are talking about all the people or things in a group or all the parts of something.

example.ex: I'd spent all I had, every last penny...
example.tran: 我把钱全部花光了，一分不剩。

example.ex: You'll never quite get rid of every last bit of grit...
example.tran: 无法把所有的沙砾都清除干净。

entry.def: The expression last in, first out is used to say that the last person who started work in an organization should be the first person to leave it, if fewer people are needed.
entry.tran: （需要裁员时首先解雇新员工的）“后进先出”原则

example.ex: Workers will go on a 'last in, first out' basis.
example.tran: 对工人的裁员原则是“后进先出”。

entry.def: You can use expressions such as the last I heard and the last she heard to introduce a piece of information that is the most recent that you have on a particular subject.
entry.tran: 我/她最近一次听到有关…的消息；最新消息

example.ex: The last I heard, Joe and Irene were still happily married.
example.tran: 我最近一次听说时，乔和艾琳仍然是一对快乐的夫妻。

entry.def: If you leave something or someone until last, you delay using, choosing, or dealing with them until you have used, chosen, or dealt with all the others.

example.ex: I have left my best wine until last...
example.tran: 我把最好的酒留到了最后。

example.ex: I picked first all the people who usually were left till last.
example.tran: 我先挑出了所有通常留到最后的人。

entry.def: If you see the last of someone, you do not expect to see them or deal with them again.

example.ex: I honestly thought I'd seen the last of you.
example.tran: 老实说我以为再也不用见到你了。

entry.def: If you say that something goes on happening to the last, you mean that it happens throughout the whole of a book, film, or event.
entry.tran: 贯穿（全书、整部电影或整件事情）

example.ex: ...a highly readable political thriller with plenty of twists of plot to keep you guessing to the last.
example.tran: 一部可读性极强的政治惊悚小说，情节峰回路转，不到最后一刻绝对猜不中结局

entry.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person to the last, you are emphasizing that they continue to be that kind of person.

example.ex: A gentleman to the last, he did not run, but merely attempted to stroll away...
example.tran: 他始终保持绅士风度，没有拔脚就跑，只是试图移步走开。

example.ex: Armstrong was tall and handsome to the last.
example.tran: 阿姆斯特朗从来都是这么高大、英俊。

entry.def: You use expressions such as to the last detail and to the last man to indicate that a plan, situation, or activity includes every single person, thing, or part involved.
entry.tran: （表示全部包括在内）任何一丝细节/ 每一个人

example.ex: Every movement, no matter how casual and spontaneous, needs to be worked out to the last detail...
example.tran: 对每一个动作，无论它显得多么随意和无意识，都不能放过一丝细节。

example.ex: Our troops are being used up to the last man.
example.tran: 我们的部队已人尽其用。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English latost (adverb) 'after all others in a series', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch laatst, lest and German letzt, also to late
Old English lǣstan, of Germanic origin, related to German leisten 'afford, yield', also to last
Old English lǣste, of Germanic origin, from a base meaning 'follow'; related to Dutch leest and German Leisten
